history.content: I think the best way is to check with your l&s advisor AND the undergraduate office of Haas. They have pre-admission advising so they will be providing useful info. BTW, this is a simultaneous degree not a double major but anyway.

children.subject:
Simultaneous degrees are across colleges, (in this case LS and Haas).  

Double majors same college.

Cosmetically, the difference is whether you get one degree with two majors, or two separate degrees. See this link for details.

Practically, simultaneous degree means you're in two colleges -> have to satisfy two sets of college / breadth requirements. But you probably already knew that?

I'll note that I've definitely heard of this combination, but I don't think it's very common; certainly less common than pairing CS with math or some physical science.
What's the difference between simultaneous degree and double major?

history.content: You should also come check with us so that we can plan your schedule with you for completion of CS major requirements. Please book an appointment here

Hi all,

I'm interested in business and computer science, and I'm considering about double major in both. However, given the great challenges in both programs, I think it might be important for me to ask for help from someone  familiar with these programs.I heard that this major combination is quite common, but who should I go to? I think my top concerns are class schedules.

Could anyone give me some advice? Thanks a lot!
history.subject: Which advisor should I ask help from if I want to double major in Haas and CS?
